sentences.english: These two poems help me to further comprehend limitless oneness .
sentences.chinese: 这两首诗令我对无限的一体有更进一步的体认。

sentences.english: But it took years for other physicians to recognize the potential of umbilical cord blood transplantation.
sentences.chinese: 但过了好些年，其他医生才体认到脐带血移植的潜力。

sentences.english: Realization that freedom is your very nature, brings enormous Shakti (Energy).
sentences.chinese: 体认到自由是你的根本本性，会带来巨大的能量。

sentences.english: Third, the rampant uncertainty about what lies ahead goes entirely unacknowledged.
sentences.chinese: 其三，完全没有体认到未来发展的高度不确定性。

sentences.english: Ever has it been that love know…
sentences.chinese: 爱的体认，只有在别离之际才知其深。

sentences.english: Because I understand that the flaw in life is like a spike on our backs.
sentences.chinese: 因为我体认到生命中的缺口，彷若我们背上的一根刺。

sentences.english: In the fierce competition, Kai-jun colleagues a deep understanding of.
sentences.chinese: 在激烈的竞争中，凯俊同仁深切体认。

sentences.english: To worship is to recognize the supreme worth of God.
sentences.chinese: 敬拜就是体认到上帝至高无上的价值。

sentences.english: To worship is to realize the highest value of God.
sentences.chinese: 敬拜就是体认到上帝至高无上的价值。

sentences.english: To give is how to recognize you have received.
sentences.chinese: 分施于人是体认自己已经得到了。

definition: to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
inner transcendence (perfection through one's own inner moral cultivation, as in Confucianism, for example)
to understand/to comprehend the ultimate essence of things (Buddhism)
doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
to construct (often sth abstract, such as good relations)/to set up/to develop/construction (abstract)/architecture
